result.execSummary:
The defendant Cindi L. Carrion was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay costs and DNA surcharges.   Pay within 60 days or you will need to set up a payment plan. Payment plan enrollments are in person on Monday of each week.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Cindi L. Carrion

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Cindi L. Carrion in court with attorney Ryan Drengler. Defendant Cindi L. Carrion in custody. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Cases 15CF341 and 15CF235.
  Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement. 15CF235 - Probation and 15CF341 - jail time/time served
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
15CF235: No Contest
15CF341 Count 4: No Contest

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty15CF235 and 15CF341 Count 4.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date. 15CF341 Count 1, 2, & 3 are dismissed and read in.

ADA Constable makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Drengler concurs with recommendation and states 49 days credit. 

BY THE COURT:*************Probation***
15CF235: Forgery-Uttering PTC
W/H SEntence
3 yrs   Probation
Conditions:
 AODA & comply with treatment recommendations.  
Maintain absolute sobriety with regards to alcohol and illegal drugs.  
Use one (1) pharmacy to obtain prescriptions and disclose to agent and sign releases so agent can monitor prescription drug use and have access to pharmacy drug records and treating physician to determine compliance. 
Disclose/list any prescriptions prescribed to agent immediately.
No direct or indirect contact with Gary & Barb Fix.
  Submit DNA sample, if not already done so, and pay the surcharge.  
Comply in any other counseling as recommended by the Agent.
No restitution.
Pay costs + DNA surcharge.
No credit if revoked.

15CF341 Disorderly Conduct:
49 days jail - 49 days credit - time served.
Pay costs + DNA surcharges. Pay within 60 days or set up payment plan.

Appeal rights provided.

Defendant Cindi L. Carrion not in court, in custody in Waupaca County Jail.   Atty Ryan Drengler appeared for defendant, Cindi L Carrion. Elizabeth R. Constable appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Cases heard today are 15CF235 and 15CF341.

11:25 a.m.  Atty Constable makes statements that defendant is currently in the Waupaca County Jail.
They were hoping to complete a plea hearing today. 

BY THE COURT:
Plea hearing to be set.

3:05 p.m.   Defendant waives right to Preliminary Hearing.
 cases 15CF235 and 15CF341 both being heard for preliminary and arraignment today.
Court questions the Defendant regarding Waiver of Preliminary Hearing.
Court questions Defendant's attorney.
Court finds the Defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived the Preliminary Hearing.
On the defendants waiver of the preliminary hearing, Court determines, based on the facts contained in the complaint, there is sufficient probable cause and binds the defendant over for trial. 
Arraignment:
  State files Information.
Defendant received copy of information.
Defendant waives reading of information. 

NOT GUILTY Plea(s) entered.

Bond Continued.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 28, 2015 at 11:15 am.

Defendant Cindi L. Carrion appeared by video.  Attorney Ryan Drengler in court (has not been appointed yet but anticipates to be soon). David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  

Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.
Attorney waives time limits for preliminary hearing to be held.

Atty Drengler defers bond arguments. 
BY THE COURT:  Bond continued.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 14, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Do not have direct/indirect contact with the following persons/places:  Victoria Hudson Unless the victim goes to CAP Services to get a Family Safety Plan and then files the form with the Clerk of Courts and District Attorney.  If filed, then no abusive contact with the above named.
Do not possess any firearms or other dangerous weapons.
Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription.

ADA Cousins appears in Court.  
Defendant appears from jail by video.

ADA Cousins states facts for anticipated charges of Bail Jumping-Felony, DC (Domestic), Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor.
Court finds probable cause that a crime has been committed and that this defendant committed it.
Court informs Defendant right to an attorney and/or Public Defender.
Court questions Defendant. 
Defendant states that she will be moving into the Salvation Army and is receiving disability payments.
State requests a cash bond of $1,000.00  with conditions as stated.
Defendant makes a statment. 

Initial Appearance Scheduled for:  September 8, 2015  @ 1:30 p.m.  in Branch 3.
